original: Elofson, Olof Valter, läroverksadjunkt, Mariestad, f. 20/6/11 i Upps. av dr. phil. h. c. Anders E. o. Käthe Schmidt. G. 46 m. Eyvor Nordens-son. — Stud:ex. 30, fil. mag. 34, fil. lic. 38, fil. dr 41 o. provår 42-43 i Upp^s. E. ämneslär. i Vilhelmina 41-42, e. adj. i Hässleholm 43-45, e. o. adj. där 45- 46, adj. v. Mariestads samrealsk. 46- 47. Därjämte timlär. v. AUS 42-43 samt v. T.4 43-44. Res. t. Norge 31, Tyskl. 31, 38 o. 39, Port., Span., Nord-afr., Ital., Jugoslav, o. Schweiz 34, Engl. 36 o. 39, Frankr. 36, Ung., Balkan, Turk. o. Sovjet 39. Skr.: Zur Kenntnis ’der marinen Ostraæden Schwedens (gradiavh. 41) ’samt ytterl. ett ant. avh. o. upps. huvudsak!, betr. marina ostrac. o. fåglar.
translated: Elofson, Olof Valter, high school teacher, Mariestad, born June 20th, 1911 in Uppsala to Dr. Phil. h.c. Anders E. and Käthe Schmidt. Married in 1946 to Eyvor Nordensson. Completed secondary school in 1930, received a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1934, a Master of Arts degree in 1938, a Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1938, a Doctorate of Philosophy degree in 1941, and completed a teaching internship in Uppsala from 1942-1943. Subject teacher in Vilhelmina from 1941-1942, substitute teacher in Hässleholm from 1943-1945, acting teacher there from 1945-1946, and then a teacher at Mariestad’s coeducational secondary school from 1946-1947. In addition, taught hourly lessons at AUS from 1942-1943 and at T.4 from 1943-1944. Traveled to Norway in 1931, Germany in 1931, 1938, and 1939, Portugal, Spain, North Africa, Italy, Yugoslavia, and Switzerland in 1934, England in 1936 and 1939, France in 1936, and Hungary, the Balkans, Turkey, and the Soviet Union in 1939. Written works include “Zur Kenntnis der marinen Ostracoden Schwedens” (doctoral dissertation in 1941), and numerous other articles and papers primarily concerning marine ostracods and birds.

structured.name: Olof Valter Elofson
structured.description: Olof Valter Elofson was a high school teacher in Mariestad. He was born on June 20th, 1911 in Uppsala, to Dr. Phil. h.c. Anders E. and Käthe Schmidt. He completed his secondary school education from Uppsala University in 1930. He went on to receive a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1934, a Master of Arts degree in 1938, a Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1938, and a Doctorate of Philosophy degree in 1941, all from Uppsala University. He also completed a teaching internship in Uppsala from 1942-1943. He was a subject teacher in Vilhelmina from 1941-1942, a substitute teacher in Hässleholm from 1943-1945, an acting teacher there from 1945-1946, and then a teacher at Mariestad’s coeducational secondary school from 1946-1947. In addition to his regular teaching duties, he taught hourly lessons at various institutions. Olof was an avid traveler, and visited several countries including Norway, Germany, Portugal, Spain, North Africa, Italy, Yugoslavia, Switzerland, England, France, Hungary, the Balkans, Turkey, and the Soviet Union. Some of his written works relate to marine ostracods, birds, and other related subjects.
